Articles.Content: My jeb is sitting in the VAB wishing I would choose him. I don't use jeb bill and bob because they are too famous I like to give the new guys a chance.
My Jeb is currently in retraining from vertical liftoff specialist to horizontal start and landing.
certainly not stuck in a 100 km orbit around Kerbin.<textarea id="adlesse_unifier_magic_element_id" style="display:none;"></textarea>

Oh him? He's dead. Started a hardcore save with FAR and DRE, amongst other things. He was coming back from the first Mun mission with oodles of science. As he was re-entering he looked at the map and tried aiming for land instead of water. The next thing he knew his parachute had burned off. Oops!
jeb and bob are readying up for a rutine flight to station demeter, to replace bill and landen who when returning were shot down by a rouge CIWS turret.

I sent Jeb to Kerbal Station One, where he sits in the only kerbaled Tug (the rest are remote guided).

He has friends in the Science Lab's, but they won't let him in until he tell's them where he hid the snacks.
My Jebadiah is currently dead after a failed 2 hour trip to Minmus.
Mine is in the R&D building trying to choose what new parts to spend science points on in order to build crazy rockets with.
Actually, I don't know... I think I left him on a parking orbit and forgot about it.
My Jeb is currently en route for my first-ever crewed landing on Eeloo. Still a couple years away but he's got plenty of snacks.

My Jeb is on vacation with his wife and kids while I try to launch unmanned mission to Minmus. After landing on the Mun, he is on vacation until we get a damn probe to Minmus. Our last attempt got shot down by some AA Gun. I blame the Russians.

Confirmed, they operated it, but somehow it was Jeb's AA Gun. Hold on, I have to fire the Pyrotecnics Guy.
Kerbals take vacations? I thought they spent all of their time in the centrifuge between launches.

Jeb is en route home from Jool in his ion ship. He tried to burn out of Jool's SOI but lacked the necessary power as the Pe was on the dark side of Jool. He managed to extend his orbit just enough to catch a gravity assist from Laythe which catapulted him into the needed orbit to go home.
Back on Kerbin after a long mission to Duna. Last seen with an entourage of Kerbalinas at the beach by the KSC launchpad...

Waiting for the transfer angle from Duna. They had a rough landing, lost half the engines, and I'm so surprised that I achieved lift off that I totally forgot to do science. But I got them docked to the transfer tank, ready to go home.

On Sylvia, waiting to go to Laythe for a vacation

Btw I have 2 rep points left to 3rd rep bar, full of anticipation
Waiting for Moho insertion burn whith Bill. Meanwhile, a Jool mission is being assembled at LKO.
Orbiting Kerbin with Bill and Bob in my thrown together claw ship while I decide whether to gas it up for an asteroid mission or trash it and redesign with better tech.
Stuck in a Hitchiker storage container in low Kerbin orbit. I build a ladder on top of the hatch - Jeb got in fine, but can't get out

Waiting in Moho orbit for a refuel mission to arrive from Kerbin so he can land and complete his mission. It isn't the first time he's been stuck somewhere waiting on another mission to arrive, he was stuck on the Mun for about 30 days after the first manned mission to the Mun when it was realized he didn't have enough fuel to get back into Munar orbit (let alone back home to Kerbin).
Some Where In A Space station.
Somewhere at the bottom of the great mohole.

I took Jeb, Bill and Bob to Dres:

And now I need to find a way to get Jeb, Bill and Bob out of Dres. I'm not sure this ship has enough fuel to get back to Kerbin .
Jeb just returned from a swim after he ditched, err I mean conducted hydrodynamic suitability testing with, the KSP's newest KSO vehicle in the ocean southeast of KSC.

Jeb jumped out after being pushed.

He faceplanted on the glass.

He'll get up at some point.
